text: Fossil Coral Reef, also known locally as Bradbury Quarry, is a abandoned limestone quarry in Le Roy, New York. It contains a well-preserved Middle Devonian coral reef along with rare tabulate and rugose corals, crinoids, gastropods, and trilobites. The site was declared a National Natural Landmark in November 1967. It is often used by local paleontology classes. ==See also== *List of National Natural Landmarks in New York ==References== Category:National Natural Landmarks in New York (state) Category:Geography of Genesee County, New York
title: Fossil Coral Reef
